headline: BofA calls Comcast's cable network spin-off “strategic step”
summary: Investing.com - BofA analyst on Thursday said Comcast Corp (NASDAQ:CMCSA) decision to spin off its cable networks, excluding Bravo, and some digital assets into a separate company, was a “positive strategic step”.

headline: Comcast: Analyst's Bearishness On Cable Spinoff Is Wrong. It's A Genius Move

headline: The fate of MSNBC could be in Trump’s hands
summary: Months into President Donald Trump’s first term in the White House, his Justice Department sent shockwaves through the media industry by suing to block AT&T’s takeover of CNN owner Timer Warner.

headline: What will happen to CNBC and MSNBC when they no longer have a corporate connection to NBC News?
summary: Comcast's corporate reorganization means that there will soon be two television networks with “NBC” in their name — CNBC and MSNBC — that will no longer have any corporate connection to NBC News.  Comcast is spinning off most of its cable networks, also including USA, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and the Golf Channel, into a separate company.
